channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description:
@Quiara @BenYehudaPress @JasonLehn @KobaltBleu @chavabobava You can submit with the chapters that have been polished and you’re pleased with an outline of what is yet to be done.
@Quiara @BenYehudaPress @JasonLehn @KobaltBleu @chavabobava Also: We’re about to announce a volume on another Jewish ceremony that combines a guide of here’s-what-to-expect with lots of first person essays. That approach might work here too.
Your occasional reminder that kindness and empathy are antithetical to the Objectivist and Christian Dominionist values that animate the Republican Party. https://t.co/s5vJjepIPt
@dzkalman They do — hence premium shmura — but it’s implicit and a very different criterion.
Breaking: Not all Republicans are objectively pro-antisemitism. #RighteousGentiles https://t.co/J5P5jdOVXD
Kintsugi, but with kosher for Pesach edible gold leaf on your shmura matzah. #GvirCulture https://t.co/N4qKuaoSUp
@AkivaMCohen As Clark Kent well knew.

What's even the point of partisanship if you can't toss Jews under the bus? https://t.co/jK8qPZuPHt
Besides: Republicans don't want to lose their key "Jews-funded-Darwin's-atheist-evolutionist-lies" demographic.
@kampeas @RonJohnsonWI Also an implicit failure of the RJC. Sad.
"That's not how linguistics works!" https://t.co/qQrOGdW1uD
@cstross NATO thanks you for your efforts in strengthening Finland.

Your occasional reminder that for commercial media, not alienating the majority of their audience who voted for Trump is an obligation they legally owe their shareholders. Promoting truth and honesty and fairness is not. https://t.co/4h2yQL8uYy
@AkivaMCohen Tell us you’re not a divorce attorney without…

In which one of my favorite writers blurbs my refrigerator. https://t.co/ddmv1UUAiI
Sadly, scheduled pre-Passover cleaning will soon render it sterile and maybe even sanitary.
@rmneiss So sorry.
@ZachWeiner Seems like the infrastructure is there for a distributed computing project. Is Waldo @ Your Home?
@trekonomics My friends in suburban Tel Aviv would resent that remark.
@acandidworld @levidmorrow I’m Flatto-Sharon. Either get elected to win parliamentary immunity for your crimes, or what’s even the point of being part of the Hewish people?

@trekonomics “Walt Disney put a hall of presidents in his land to assume the mantle of legitimacy. But the redemption will not arrive until Mickey Mouse ears are worn by the Supreme Court sitting in judgement.”

@trekonomics I probably got more of the mythos than you did growing up. And my baseline is always American suburbia; Jerusalem favorably compared to Rochester for urbanity. And in the 80s when I lived there for a couple years, it was cleaner than Manhattan. I understand that has changed.

@trekonomics The interesting thing is that Disney has managed to create a mythos-based pilgrimage that is uniquely non transformative.
@trekonomics Kids visit DC in high school and resolve to run for Congress. Jerusalem and NYC are often life altering events. But Disney attracts like a pilgrimage but never transforms.
@trekonomics Indeed it is. As always, we need a better variety of myth. But what do you expect of the heirs of rabid fundamentalists and greedy slavers?

@trekonomics It’s a chance to visit a place hallowed by myth. In the way my emotions n encountering Jerusalem, D. C., and New York City reflected not just the architecture and commerce, but their respective role in the various mythos in which I was raised.
@trekonomics As someone who was more devoted to the Watergate hearings than to the Mickey Mouse show as a child, I share your disinterest in Disneyland. But for too many, it provides a rare brush with transcendence.
@trekonomics You should at least read the relevant page or two in Doctorow’s Book of Daniel.
@arielbeery Oy.
@MetsYeet @gideondabi @DougJBalloon That’s the kind of sensible perspective the Algorithm was designed to obliterate. Sorry.
